EntryPoints.Name: Data.TextLoader
EntryPoints.Desc: Import a dataset from a text file

Inputs.Name: InputFile
Inputs.Desc: Location of the input file

Inputs.Name: Arguments

Fields.Name: Column
Type
Fields.Desc: Type of the items in the column

Fields.Name: Source
AutoEnd
Fields.Desc: This range extends to the end of the line, but should be a fixed number of items

Fields.Name: VariableEnd
Fields.Desc: This range extends to the end of the line, which can vary from line to line

Fields.Name: AllOther
Fields.Desc: This range includes only other indices not specified

Fields.Name: ForceVector
Fields.Desc: Force scalar columns to be treated as vectors of length one
Source index range(s) of the column

Fields.Name: KeyRange
Fields.Desc: For a key column, this defines the range of values
Column groups. Each group is specified as name:type:numeric-ranges, eg, col=Features:R4:1-17,26,35-40

Fields.Name: HeaderFile
Fields.Desc: File containing a header with feature names. If specified, header defined in the data file (header+) is ignored.

Fields.Name: MaxRows
Fields.Desc: Maximum number of rows to produce

Fields.Name: AllowQuoting
Fields.Desc: Whether the input may include quoted values, which can contain separator characters, colons, and distinguish empty values from missing values. When true, consecutive separators denote a missing value and an empty value is denoted by "". When false, consecutive separators denote an empty value.

Fields.Name: AllowSparse
Fields.Desc: Whether the input may include sparse representations

Fields.Name: InputSize
Fields.Desc: Number of source columns in the text data. Default is that sparse rows contain their size information.

Fields.Name: HasHeader
Fields.Desc: Data file has header with feature names. Header is read only if options 'hs' and 'hf' are not specified.

Inputs.Desc: Arguments

Inputs.Name: NumLeaves
Inputs.Desc: The max number of leaves in each regression tree

Inputs.Name: FeatureColumn
Inputs.Desc: Column to use for features

Inputs.Name: MinDocumentsInLeafs
Inputs.Desc: The minimal number of documents allowed in a leaf of a regression tree, out of the subsampled data

Inputs.Name: LabelColumn
Inputs.Desc: Column to use for labels

Inputs.Name: WeightColumn
Inputs.Desc: Column to use for example weight

Inputs.Name: GroupIdColumn
Inputs.Desc: Column to use for example groupId

Inputs.Name: NormalizeFeatures
Inputs.Desc: Normalize option for the feature column

Inputs.Name: Caching
Inputs.Desc: Whether learner should cache input training data

Inputs.Name: MaxTreeOutput
Inputs.Desc: Upper bound on absolute value of single tree output

Inputs.Name: Calibrator
Inputs.Desc: The calibrator kind to apply to the predictor. Specify null for no calibration

Inputs.Name: MaxCalibrationExamples
Inputs.Desc: The maximum number of examples to use when training the calibrator

Inputs.Name: QuantileSampleCount
Inputs.Desc: Number of labels to be sampled from each leaf to make the distribtuion

Inputs.Name: ParallelTrainer
Inputs.Desc: Allows to choose Parallel FastTree Learning Algorithm

Inputs.Name: NumThreads
Inputs.Desc: The number of threads to use

Inputs.Name: RngSeed
Inputs.Desc: The seed of the random number generator

Inputs.Name: FeatureSelectSeed
Inputs.Desc: The seed of the active feature selection

Inputs.Name: EntropyCoefficient
Inputs.Desc: The entropy (regularization) coefficient between 0 and 1

Inputs.Name: HistogramPoolSize
Inputs.Desc: The number of histograms in the pool (between 2 and numLeaves)

Inputs.Name: DiskTranspose
Inputs.Desc: Whether to utilize the disk or the data's native transposition facilities (where applicable) when performing the transpose

Inputs.Name: FeatureFlocks
Inputs.Desc: Whether to collectivize features during dataset preparation to speed up training

Inputs.Name: CategoricalSplit
Inputs.Desc: Whether to do split based on multiple categorical feature values.

Inputs.Name: MaxCategoricalGroupsPerNode
Inputs.Desc: Maximum categorical split groups to consider when splitting on a categorical feature. Split groups are a collection of split points. This is used to reduce overfitting when there many categorical features.

Inputs.Name: MaxCategoricalSplitPoints
Inputs.Desc: Maximum categorical split points to consider when splitting on a categorical feature.

Inputs.Name: MinDocsPercentageForCategoricalSplit
Inputs.Desc: Minimum categorical docs percentage in a bin to consider for a split.

Inputs.Name: MinDocsForCategoricalSplit
Inputs.Desc: Minimum categorical doc count in a bin to consider for a split.

Inputs.Name: Bias
Inputs.Desc: Bias for calculating gradient for each feature bin for a categorical feature.

Inputs.Name: Bundling
Inputs.Desc: Bundle low population bins. Bundle.None(0): no bundling, Bundle.AggregateLowPopulation(1): Bundle low population, Bundle.Adjacent(2): Neighbor low population bundle.

Inputs.Name: MaxBins
Inputs.Desc: Maximum number of distinct values (bins) per feature

Inputs.Name: SparsifyThreshold
Inputs.Desc: Sparsity level needed to use sparse feature representation

Inputs.Name: FeatureFirstUsePenalty
Inputs.Desc: The feature first use penalty coefficient

Inputs.Name: FeatureReusePenalty
Inputs.Desc: The feature re-use penalty (regularization) coefficient

Inputs.Name: GainConfidenceLevel
Inputs.Desc: Tree fitting gain confidence requirement (should be in the range [0,1) ).

Inputs.Name: SoftmaxTemperature
Inputs.Desc: The temperature of the randomized softmax distribution for choosing the feature

Inputs.Name: ExecutionTimes
Inputs.Desc: Print execution time breakdown to stdout

Inputs.Name: FeatureFraction
Inputs.Desc: The fraction of features (chosen randomly) to use on each iteration

Inputs.Name: BaggingSize
Inputs.Desc: Number of trees in each bag (0 for disabling bagging)

Inputs.Name: BaggingTrainFraction
Inputs.Desc: Percentage of training examples used in each bag

Inputs.Name: SplitFraction
Inputs.Desc: The fraction of features (chosen randomly) to use on each split

Inputs.Name: Smoothing
Inputs.Desc: Smoothing paramter for tree regularization

Inputs.Name: AllowEmptyTrees
Inputs.Desc: When a root split is impossible, allow training to proceed

Inputs.Name: FeatureCompressionLevel
Inputs.Desc: The level of feature compression to use

Inputs.Name: CompressEnsemble
Inputs.Desc: Compress the tree Ensemble

Inputs.Name: MaxTreesAfterCompression
Inputs.Desc: Maximum Number of trees after compression

Inputs.Desc: Print metrics graph for the first test set

Inputs.Desc: Print Train and Validation metrics in graph

EntryPoints.Name: Trainers.KMeansPlusPlusClusterer

EntryPoints.Name: Transforms.TreeLeafFeaturizer
EntryPoints.Desc: Trains a tree ensemble, or loads it from a file, then maps a numeric feature vector to three outputs: 1. A vector containing the individual tree outputs of the tree ensemble. 2. A vector indicating the leaves that the feature vector falls on in the tree ensemble. 3. A vector indicating the paths that the feature vector falls on in the tree ensemble. If a both a model file and a trainer are specified - will use the model file. If neither are specified, will train a default FastTree model. This can handle key labels by training a regression model towards their optionally permuted indices.

Inputs.Name: Data
Inputs.Desc: Input dataset

Inputs.Name: PredictorModel
Inputs.Desc: Trainer to use

Inputs.Name: Suffix
Inputs.Desc: Output column: The suffix to append to the default column names

Inputs.Name: LabelPermutationSeed
Inputs.Desc: If specified, determines the permutation seed for applying this featurizer to a multiclass problem.

Components.Name: FastTreeRegression
Components.Desc: Trains gradient boosted decision trees to fit target values using least-squares.

Settings.Name: NumTrees
Settings.Desc: Total number of decision trees to create in the ensemble

Settings.Name: TrainingData
Settings.Desc: The data to be used for training

Settings.Name: NumLeaves
Settings.Desc: The max number of leaves in each regression tree

Settings.Name: FeatureColumn
Settings.Desc: Column to use for features

Settings.Name: MinDocumentsInLeafs
Settings.Desc: The minimal number of documents allowed in a leaf of a regression tree, out of the subsampled data

Settings.Name: LabelColumn
Settings.Desc: Column to use for labels

Settings.Name: LearningRates
Settings.Desc: The learning rate

Settings.Name: WeightColumn
Settings.Desc: Column to use for example weight

Settings.Name: GroupIdColumn
Settings.Desc: Column to use for example groupId

Settings.Name: NormalizeFeatures
Settings.Desc: Normalize option for the feature column

Settings.Name: Caching
Settings.Desc: Whether learner should cache input training data

Settings.Name: BestStepRankingRegressionTrees
Settings.Desc: Use best regression step trees?

Settings.Name: UseLineSearch
Settings.Desc: Should we use line search for a step size

Settings.Name: NumPostBracketSteps
Settings.Desc: Number of post-bracket line search steps

Settings.Name: MinStepSize
Settings.Desc: Minimum line search step size

Settings.Name: OptimizationAlgorithm
Settings.Desc: Optimization algorithm to be used (GradientDescent, AcceleratedGradientDescent)

Settings.Name: EarlyStoppingRule
Settings.Desc: Early stopping rule. (Validation set (/valid) is required.)

Settings.Name: EarlyStoppingMetrics
Settings.Desc: Early stopping metrics. (For regression, 1: L1, 2:L2; for ranking, 1:NDCG@1, 3:NDCG@3)

Settings.Name: EnablePruning
Settings.Desc: Enable post-training pruning to avoid overfitting. (a validation set is required)

Settings.Name: UseTolerantPruning
Settings.Desc: Use window and tolerance for pruning

Settings.Name: PruningThreshold
Settings.Desc: The tolerance threshold for pruning

Settings.Name: PruningWindowSize
Settings.Desc: The moving window size for pruning

Settings.Name: Shrinkage
Settings.Desc: Shrinkage

Settings.Name: DropoutRate
Settings.Desc: Dropout rate for tree regularization

Settings.Name: GetDerivativesSampleRate
Settings.Desc: Sample each query 1 in k times in the GetDerivatives function

Settings.Name: WriteLastEnsemble
Settings.Desc: Write the last ensemble instead of the one determined by early stopping

Settings.Name: MaxTreeOutput
Settings.Desc: Upper bound on absolute value of single tree output

Settings.Name: RandomStart
Settings.Desc: Training starts from random ordering (determined by /r1)

Settings.Name: FilterZeroLambdas
Settings.Desc: Filter zero lambdas during training

Settings.Name: BaselineScoresFormula
Settings.Desc: Freeform defining the scores that should be used as the baseline ranker

Settings.Name: BaselineAlphaRisk
Settings.Desc: Baseline alpha for tradeoffs of risk (0 is normal training)

Settings.Name: PositionDiscountFreeform
Settings.Desc: The discount freeform which specifies the per position discounts of documents in a query (uses a single variable P for position where P=0 is first position)

Settings.Name: ParallelTrainer
Settings.Desc: Allows to choose Parallel FastTree Learning Algorithm

Settings.Name: NumThreads
Settings.Desc: The number of threads to use

Settings.Name: RngSeed
Settings.Desc: The seed of the random number generator

Settings.Name: FeatureSelectSeed
Settings.Desc: The seed of the active feature selection

Settings.Name: EntropyCoefficient
Settings.Desc: The entropy (regularization) coefficient between 0 and 1

Settings.Name: HistogramPoolSize
Settings.Desc: The number of histograms in the pool (between 2 and numLeaves)

Settings.Name: DiskTranspose
Settings.Desc: Whether to utilize the disk or the data's native transposition facilities (where applicable) when performing the transpose

Settings.Name: FeatureFlocks
Settings.Desc: Whether to collectivize features during dataset preparation to speed up training

Settings.Name: CategoricalSplit
Settings.Desc: Whether to do split based on multiple categorical feature values.

Settings.Name: MaxCategoricalGroupsPerNode
Settings.Desc: Maximum categorical split groups to consider when splitting on a categorical feature. Split groups are a collection of split points. This is used to reduce overfitting when there many categorical features.

Settings.Name: MaxCategoricalSplitPoints
Settings.Desc: Maximum categorical split points to consider when splitting on a categorical feature.

Settings.Name: MinDocsPercentageForCategoricalSplit
Settings.Desc: Minimum categorical docs percentage in a bin to consider for a split.

Settings.Name: MinDocsForCategoricalSplit
Settings.Desc: Minimum categorical doc count in a bin to consider for a split.

Settings.Name: Bias
Settings.Desc: Bias for calculating gradient for each feature bin for a categorical feature.

Settings.Name: Bundling
Settings.Desc: Bundle low population bins. Bundle.None(0): no bundling, Bundle.AggregateLowPopulation(1): Bundle low population, Bundle.Adjacent(2): Neighbor low population bundle.

Settings.Name: MaxBins
Settings.Desc: Maximum number of distinct values (bins) per feature

Settings.Name: SparsifyThreshold
Settings.Desc: Sparsity level needed to use sparse feature representation

Settings.Name: FeatureFirstUsePenalty
Settings.Desc: The feature first use penalty coefficient

Settings.Name: FeatureReusePenalty
Settings.Desc: The feature re-use penalty (regularization) coefficient

Settings.Name: GainConfidenceLevel
Settings.Desc: Tree fitting gain confidence requirement (should be in the range [0,1) ).

Settings.Name: SoftmaxTemperature
Settings.Desc: The temperature of the randomized softmax distribution for choosing the feature

Components.Name: NGram
Components.Desc: Extracts NGrams from text and convert them to vector using dictionary.

Settings.Name: NgramLength
Settings.Desc: Ngram length

Settings.Name: SkipLength
Settings.Desc: Maximum number of tokens to skip when constructing an ngram

Settings.Name: AllLengths
Settings.Desc: Whether to include all ngram lengths up to NgramLength or only NgramLength

Settings.Name: MaxNumTerms
Settings.Desc: Maximum number of ngrams to store in the dictionary

Settings.Name: Weighting
Settings.Desc: The weighting criteria

Components.Name: NGramHash
Components.Desc: Extracts NGrams from text and convert them to vector using hashing trick.

Settings.Name: HashBits
Settings.Desc: Number of bits to hash into. Must be between 1 and 30, inclusive.

Settings.Name: NgramLength
Settings.Desc: Ngram length

Settings.Name: SkipLength
Settings.Desc: Maximum number of tokens to skip when constructing an ngram

Settings.Name: AllLengths
Settings.Desc: Whether to include all ngram lengths up to ngramLength or only ngramLength

Settings.Name: Seed
Settings.Desc: Hashing seed

Settings.Name: Ordered
Settings.Desc: Whether the position of each source column should be included in the hash (when there are multiple source columns).

Settings.Name: InvertHash
Settings.Desc: Limit the number of keys used to generate the slot name to this many. 0 means no invert hashing, -1 means no limit.

Components.Name: Single
Components.Desc: Single node machine learning process.

Components.Name: ParquetPathParser
Components.Desc: Extract name/value pairs from Parquet formatted directory names. Example path: Year=2018/Month=12/data1.parquet

Components.Name: SimplePathParser
Components.Desc: A simple parser that extracts directory names as column values. Column names are defined as arguments.

Settings.Name: Columns

Fields.Name: Source
Fields.Desc: Index of the directory representing this column.

Settings.Desc: Column definitions used to override the Partitioned Path Parser. Expected with the format name:type:numeric-source, e.g. col=MyFeature:R4:1

Settings.Name: Type
Settings.Desc: Data type of each column.
